court:
HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
PRESENT
petitioners: NENMARA P.O., CHITTUR TALUK, PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678508.
respondents: REPRESENTED BY THE SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE,
outcome:
ORDER
Petitioners are the accused in S.C. No.787/2016
of the Assistant Sessions Court(Additional), Palakkad, which
has arisen from Crime No.619/2016 of Nenmara Police
Station, for the offences punishable under Sections 143,
147, 148, 341, 323, 324 and 308 read with Section 149 IPC.

2. It seems that the matter has been amicably
settled between the parties.

3. On going through the matter, this Court is
satisfied that there are no ingredients to invite an offence
under Section 308 IPC in the matter. The 2™ respondent,
who is the de facto complainant, has filed Annexure-A3
affidavit, affirming that the matter has been amicably settled
between him and the petitioners and he has no complaints
against the petitioners.

DLs
2018/KER/271
Crl.M.C.8827/2017 >.

4. When the matter has been amicably settled
between the parties, no purpose would be served in
proceeding with the matter any further. Matters being so, all
further proceedings against the petitioners in S.C.
No.787/2016 of the Assistant Sessions Court(Additional),
Palakkad, which has arisen from Crime No.619/2016 of
Nenmara Police Station, can be quashed

IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
PRESENT:
THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA
THURSDAY, THE 4TH DAY OF JANUARY 2018 / 14TH POUSHA, 1939
Cr1.MC.No. 8827 of 2017
SC 787/2016 OF ASSISTANT SESSIONS COURT, (ADDITIONAL) PALAKKAD
CRIME NO. 619/2016 OF NENMARA POLICE STATION , PALAKKAD

AGED 20 YEARS, S/O.RADHAKRISHNAN,

NENMARA P.O., PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678508.

ALATHUR, PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678573.
5 ASHIQ,

CHINGANTHODI HOUSE, KONNANCHERI,
AYAKKAD, VADAKKANCHERI, PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678683.
6 ATHUL,
AGED 19 YEARS, S/O.SASI, ATHUL NIVAS,
PUTHIYANKAM P.O., PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678541.
7  ADARSH,
AGED 20 YEARS, S/O.UDHAYABALAN, ACHUTHA NIVAS,
VADAVANNOOR, KOLLANGODE, PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678506.
BY ADV.SRI.A.HAROON RASHEED
RESPONDENT (S) /COMPLAINANT AND STATE:
1. STATE OF KERALA,
REPRESENTED BY THE SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE,
NENMARA POLICE STATION, PALAKKAD DISTRICT,
THROUGH THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR,
HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM.

BS atte

2. SOORAJ,
AGED 19 YEARS, S/O.CHANDRAN,
RESIDING AT GEETHA NIVAS, VADAKKUMPADAM,
KODUVAYUR P.O., PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678201.

abe
2018/KER/271
B. KEMAL PASHA, J.
Dated this the 4" day of January, 2018
ORDER
Petitioners are the accused in S.C. No.787/2016
of the Assistant Sessions Court(Additional), Palakkad, which
has arisen from Crime No.619/2016 of Nenmara Police
Station, for the offences punishable under Sections 143,
147, 148, 341, 323, 324 and 308 read with Section 149 IPC.

2. It seems that the matter has been amicably
settled between the parties.

3. On going through the matter, this Court is
satisfied that there are no ingredients to invite an offence
under Section 308 IPC in the matter. The 2™ respondent,
who is the de facto complainant, has filed Annexure-A3
affidavit, affirming that the matter has been amicably settled
between him and the petitioners and he has no complaints
against the petitioners.

DLs
2018/KER/271
Crl.M.C.8827/2017 >.

4. When the matter has been amicably settled
between the parties, no purpose would be served in
proceeding with the matter any further. Matters being so, all
further proceedings against the petitioners in S.C.
No.787/2016 of the Assistant Sessions Court(Additional),
Palakkad, which has arisen from Crime No.619/2016 of
Nenmara Police Station, can be quashed.

In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and all further
proceedings against the petitioners in S.C. No.787/2016 of
the Assistant Sessions Court(Additional), Palakkad, which
has arisen from Crime No.619/2016 of Nenmara_ Police
Station, are quashed.

Sd/-
(B.KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE)
aks/04/01
